casebody.data:
BETHLEHEM STEEL CO. v. NILES-BEMENT-POND CO. (Circuit Court of Appeals, Third Circuit. July 21, 1909.) No. 40. Appeal from the Circuit Court of the United States for the District of New Jersey. Thomas W. Bake-well and Francis T. Chambers, for appellant. Charles H. Duell and F. P. War-field, for appellee.

Before GRAY, Circuit Judge, and BRADFORD and YOUNG, District Judges.

PER CURIAM.

The opinion filed In this case by the learned judge of the court below (see 166 Fed. 880) has so dearly stated the reasons upon which our own determination of this ease is founded that further and independent discussion of them on our part is rendered unnecessary. Therefore, adopting the opinion of the court below' as the opinion of this court, its decree is hereby affirmed.
